answers.answer:
Medical recovery, physical medicine, and rehabilitation services include specific procedures such as physiotherapy, hydrotherapy, massage, and aerosols. Additionally, specialized treatments like mineral baths, natural skunks, and mud wraps are offered, particularly in balneo-climatic resorts.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and look for the "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system." The relevant details can be found under the section discussing "Medical recovery, physical medicine and rehabilitation services."

answers.answer:
Physical medicine and rehabilitation services can be provided on both an outpatient and inpatient basis.

You can find this information on the website dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services under the section titled "Medical recovery, physical medicine and rehabilitation services".

answers.answer:
Individuals can receive outpatient physical medicine and rehabilitation services in treatment bases, within the clinical specialty of physical medicine and rehabilitation.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and look under the section titled "Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases".

answers.answer:
Specific physical medicine and rehabilitation procedures are granted according to a Plan of specific procedures, for periods and a flow established by a physical medicine and rehabilitation specialist.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read under the section "Medical recovery, physical medicine and rehabilitation services".

answers.answer:
An insured adult or child can receive outpatient physical medicine and rehabilitation procedures for a maximum period of 21 days per year.

To find this detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and refer to the section titled "Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases".
answers.bResponse:
An insured adult or child can receive outpatient physical medicine and rehabilitation procedures for a maximum period of 21 days per year.

To find this detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and refer to the section titled "Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services

answers.answer:
Yes, children aged 0-18 with a confirmed diagnosis of cerebral palsy are entitled to specific physical medicine and rehabilitation medical procedures for a maximum period of 42 days per year, which is an extended duration compared to the general 21 days per year.

To find this detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and look under the section "Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, children aged 0-18 with a confirmed diagnosis of cerebral palsy are entitled to specific physical medicine and rehabilitation medical procedures for a maximum period of 42 days per year, which is an extended duration compared to the general 21 days per year.

To find this detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and look under the section "Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services

answers.answer:
A maximum of 4 specific physical medicine and rehabilitation procedures are typically covered per day of treatment.

To find this information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read under the section titled "Medical recovery, physical medicine and rehabilitation services," specifically where it discusses the number of procedures covered per day.

The rights to medical recovery and rehabilitation services are outlined in the “Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system” by the National Health Insurance House.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the content under the "Medical recovery, physical medicine and rehabilitation services" section.
